title: Emerging international connections of philanthropy: exploring the global and local geography of UK registered charities working overseas
abstractText:
Donations from the public to charities working overseas have grown considerably over the last 30 years. There are now around 11,000 charities that work internationally. This includes many of the well-known larger charities, including Oxfam, Save the Children and Christian Aid, but also a large number of smaller organisations.

This project aims to provide, for the first time, an overview of the charitable connections between the UK and overseas, including:

Global patterns in charitiesâ€™ country of operation:

  • where do UK registered charities work overseas?
  • How does this compare to the country pattern of Official Development Assistance (ODA) provided by government?

 Local patterns in overseas charitable connections:

  • can particularly strong links between places in the UK and particular overseas countries be identified?
  • Empirical context on the overseas charitable sector: of those charities working overseas, how many are involved in development and relief?
  • What roles do they play?
  • To what extent has there been a growth in the number of voluntary organisations working overseas? 

The project will use publicly available data from the Charity Commission to answer these questions.
